attributes.action: David Cameron to apologise for support of Section 28
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron supported Section 28, which prohibited the fair education of young people about homosexuality. When unelected, David Cameron backtracked about his previous support of Section 28 whilst he was on the campaign trail. In terms of fairness, now that he is elected, he must apologise for his support of Section 28, and promise that no such legislation will be considered by his government in the future.
